pull.title: scripted-diff: Remove BOOST_FOREACH, Q_FOREACH and PAIRTYPE
pull.body:
Separated from #10193 since the reverse iterator isn't working there, as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10193#issuecomment-293742166 (but without removing #include <boost/foreach.hpp> everywhere except where BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH is needed).

Seems to compete with #10497

issue.title: scripted-diff: Remove #include <boost/foreach.hpp>
issue.body:
EDIT: Originally this was only going to remove 'BOOST_FOREACH' and '#include <boost/foreach.hpp>' from src/qr, then src/wallet too, but by popular demand, the scope is increased to fully remove #include <boost/foreach.hpp> the whole project.

Apart from a few small self documented commits in preparation for the scripted commits, the content of the scripted scripts themselves is:

```
sed -i 's/BOOST_FOREACH *(\(.*\),/for (\1 :/' ./src/*.h ./src/*.cpp ./src/*/*.h ./src/*/*.cpp ./src/*/*/*.h ./src/*/*/*.cpp ;
sed -i 's/BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH(\(.*\), \(.*\))/for (\1 : reverse_iterate(\2))/' ./src/*.h ./src/*.cpp ./src/*/*.h ./src/*/*.cpp ;
sed -i ':a;N;$!ba;s/#include <boost\/foreach.hpp>\n//' ./src/*.h ./src/*.cpp ./src/*/*.h ./src/*/*.cpp ./src/*/*/*.h ./src/*/*/*.cpp
```

Dependencies:

- [x] devtools/net: add a verifier for scriptable changes. Use it to make CNode::id private. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10189
- [x] scripted-diff: Remove BOOST_FOREACH, Q_FOREACH and PAIRTYPE #10502

issue.title: remove the PAIRTYPE macro
issue.body:
Replace all BOOST_FOREACH and Q_FOREACH loops using it with range
based loops.

events.body:
utACK 9eafbf2

Excellent work! I ❤️ modern C++
Added one small preparation commit since not all environments where passing travis.
Needed rebase after #10195. Just run the sed scripts again. Review should be as simple as it was, more or less.

issue.title: scripted-diff: Use the C++11 keyword nullptr to denote the pointer literal instead of the macro NULL
issue.body:
Since C++11 the macro `NULL` may be:
* an integer literal with value zero, or
* a prvalue of type `std::nullptr_t`

By using the C++11 keyword `nullptr` we are guaranteed a prvalue of type `std::nullptr_t`.

For a more thorough discussion, see "A name for the null pointer: nullptr" (Sutter &
Stroustrup), http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2007/n2431.pdf

With this patch applied there are no `NULL` macro usages left in the repo:

```
$ git grep NULL -- "*.cpp" "*.h" | egrep -v '(/univalue/|/secp256k1/|/leveldb/|_NULL|NULLDUMMY|torcontrol.*NULL|NULL cert)' | wc -l
0
```

The road towards `nullptr` (C++11) is split into two PRs:
* `NULL` → `nullptr` is handled in PR #10483 (scripted, this PR)
* `0` → `nullptr` is handled in PR #10645 (manual)

events.body: Concept ACK. Nit: you can add a commit that removes the `#include <boost/foreach.hpp>` directives.

> you can add a commit that removes the #include <boost/foreach.hpp> directives.

But not in the whole project yet, because I'm not able to remove BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH yet, see #10193 on top of this one. I can remove it only on the files that I can for now.
utACK 1238f13cf6ccf1177b66df735f360c61ae1dc20b. Seems fine to remove includes in a followup pr as long as some of them are still needed for reverse iteration.

issue.title: Improve commit-check-script.sh
issue.body:
This makes an improvement to commit-check-script.sh (which was introduced in #10189):
* Fail when a VERIFY SCRIPT is present in the commit body, but no `scripted-diff` exists in its title. This would have caught a bug in #10321 (which had `script-diff` instead of `scripted-diff`) by reducing the reviewer burden from noticing a correct `scripted-diff` to that or a correct VERIFY SCRIPT (using fairly fuzzy rules).

issue.title: Util: Remove redundant calls to argsGlobal.IsArgSet()
issue.body:
Includes:

- [x] Introduce an ArgsManager class encapsulating cs_args, mapArgs and mapMultiArgs #9494 

I'm happy squashing the indentation commit, leaving it separated or leaving it out of the PR.

issue.title: TODO for release notes 0.15.0
issue.body:
Whenever possible, please amend the `doc/release-notes.md` within the pull that introduces a new fancy feature or breaks compatibility.

If this is not possible, please mention the pull here, so it can be taken care of later:

* [x] RBF GUI (#9592, ...)
* [x] #9602: Remove coin age priority and free transactions
* [x] [wallet] Rescan abortability #10208 adds `abortrescan` RPC
* [x] leveldb 1.20 #10138
* [x] #9733 adds `getchaintxstats` RPC
* [x] #9966 adds `-persistmempool` option
* [x] #8952 adds query options to `listunspent` RPC
* [x] #10478 adds `bindaddr` address for peer connections to `getpeerinfo` 
* [x] #9740 makes `dumpwallet` return the full absolute path to the dumped wallet
* [x] #10400 adds `uptime` command
* [x] Move transaction combining from signrawtransaction to new RPC #10571
* [x]  Do not allow users to get keys from keypool without reserving them #10784 


<sub>Feel free to edit

The release notes are now edited on the wiki:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.15.0-Release-notes

issue.title: Backport Boost removal PRs
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7613
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10502
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10193
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13961
- bitcoin/bitcoin#13734
  - Only the second commit (we don't need the first).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#14480

Part of #4819.

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.
